com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.backend.services

Interface IOdpService


  • public interface IOdpService
    Service interface for ODP (Ordine di Pagamento) management operations. Provides CRUD operations and search functionality for payment orders.
    Author:
    Claude Code

                     int from,

        Searches for ODPs matching the specified criteria.
        Parameters:
        searchCriteria - the criteria to filter ODPs
        sortCriteria - the criteria to sort ODPs
        from - the starting index for pagination (0-based)
        rows - the maximum number of rows to return
        Returns:
        list of ODPs matching the criteria, empty list if none found

      • createOdp

        String createOdp(Odp odp,
                 String userId)
        Creates a new ODP in the system. Only users with RoleType.PROPOSER can perform this operation.

        Backend-Only Field Constraints:

        The following fields are automatically set by the backend and must NOT be provided in the input ODP object. If any of these fields are set, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown:

        • id - Assigned by backend during creation
        • assignee - Set by backend workflow logic
        • dataCompilazione - Set to current timestamp

        Mandatory Field Constraints:

        The following field is mandatory and must be provided:

        • azienda - Must not be null

        Automatic Initialization:

        Upon successful creation, the backend will automatically set:

        • id
        • dataCompilazione to the current date and time
        Parameters:
        odp - the ODP to create (must not have backend-only fields set)
        userId - the user ID of the current user
        Returns:
        the unique identifier of the created ODP
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if user's role does not have create permission
        IllegalArgumentException - if userId is null or user not found, or if any backend-only field (id, assignee, dataCompilazione) is set, or if mandatory field azienda is null

      • updateOdp

        void updateOdp(Odp odp,
               String userId)
        Updates an existing ODP with new information. Only users with RoleType.PROPOSER can perform this operation.
        Parameters:
        odp - the ODP with updated information
        userId - the user ID of the current user
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if user's role does not have update permission
        IllegalArgumentException - if userId is null or user not found

      • deleteOdp

        void deleteOdp(String id,
               String userId)
        Deletes an ODP from the system. Only users with RoleType.PROPOSER can perform this operation.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique identifier of the ODP to delete
        userId - the user ID of the current user
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if user's role does not have delete permission
        IllegalArgumentException - if userId is null or user not found

      • submitOdpForApproval

        void submitOdpForApproval(String id,
                          String userId)
        Submits an ODP for approval, transitioning it from DRAFT to the first authorization state. Only users with RoleType.PROPOSER can perform this operation, and only the owner of the ODP can submit it.

        This method validates that:

        • The user has permission to submit (must be PROPOSER role)
        • The user is the owner of the ODP
        • The ODP is in DRAFT state (eligible for approval)

        Upon successful submission, the ODP state transitions from DRAFT to WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_1, initiating the authorization workflow.

        Parameters:
        id - the unique identifier of the ODP to submit
        userId - the user ID of the current user (must be the owner)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if user's role does not have submit permission, or if the user is not the owner, or if the ODP is not in DRAFT state
        IllegalArgumentException - if userId is null, user not found, or ODP not found

      • approveOdp

        boolean approveOdp(String id,
                   String password,
                   OdpAuthorizationStep step)
        Approves an ODP by adding an authorization step to its authorization flow. The authorization step must contain a user with a role that has authorization permissions.

        This method performs the following validations before processing the approval:

        • Validates the provided password against the user's credentials
        • Verifies that the user in the authorization step has the canApprove() permission
        • Verifies that the ODP can be approved by the user (using OdpUtils.isCanBeApproved())

        If password validation fails, the method returns false and aborts execution without adding the authorization step or modifying the ODP.

        Parameters:
        id - the unique identifier of the ODP to approve
        password - the user's password for authentication
        step - the authorization step containing the user performing the approval, date, and notes
        Returns:
        true if the authorization step was added successfully, false if password validation failed (method execution is aborted)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the user's role does not have authorization permission (canApprove() returns false) or if the ODP cannot be approved by the user

      • validatePassword

        boolean validatePassword(String userId,
                         String password)
        Validates a user's password for authentication.
        Parameters:
        userId - the unique identifier of the user
        password - the password to validate
        Returns:
        true if the password is valid for the user, false otherwise

      • retrieveCompanies

        user - the user for whom to retrieve companies
        Returns:
        list of companies the user has access to, empty list if none

      • retrieveAuthorizationFlow

        OdpAuthorizationFlow retrieveAuthorizationFlow(String id)
        Retrieves the complete authorization flow for an ODP. The authorization flow contains all authorization steps (approvals/rejections) that have been performed on the ODP.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique identifier of the ODP
        Returns:
        the authorization flow containing all approval/rejection steps

      • retrieveOdpUser

        OdpUser retrieveOdpUser(String userId)
        Retrieves an OdpUser object with the associated role from the repository.

        This method delegates to the repository to look up the user's role and construct an OdpUser instance containing both the user ID and the associated role.

        Parameters:
        userId - the unique identifier of the user to retrieve
        Returns:
        the OdpUser instance with user ID and role
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if userId is null, empty, or user not found
        RuntimeException - if an error occurs retrieving user data
